update.description:
~~This is the tutorial as-is, but I think we agreed on a smaller, more manageable point cloud so once I get that I’ll redo the screenshots and make sure it still makes sense.~~ \*

I also removed the menu selection screenshots because I thought they’re kind of self explanatory but if anyone has a good reason to keep them in I’m happy to put them back.

\*updated with smaller point cloud

‌
update.title: Point cloud to mesh tutorial

content.raw: I resized the extra wide pictures. 800 was a little too small to see some of the detail of the full-window screenshots so I made it 1000.
content.html: I resized the extra wide pictures. 800 was a little too small to see some of the detail of the full-window screenshots so I made it 1000.

content.raw: nice, the images are showing up now. One minor note is that a couple of image are quite large there does not seem to be a horizontal scrollbar so I don’t see the right part of the screenshots on my laptop. Maybe they can be resized? Either by resizing the actual image, or we could use html to display it instead of markdown: `` ‌
content.html:
nice, the images are showing up now. One minor note is that a couple of image are quite large there does not seem to be a horizontal scrollbar so I don’t see the right part of the screenshots on my laptop. Maybe they can be resized? Either by resizing the actual image, or we could use html to display it instead of markdown:

<img src="http://path_to_img.png" width="800" height="640"/>

‌

update.title: Point cloud to mesh tutorial

content.raw: I *think* what I did was to view the raw image files from the pull request branch and copy the URL. We could do that here for now. And change it to something else when we go to GitHub :)
content.html: I think what I did was to view the raw image files from the pull request branch and copy the URL. We could do that here for now. And change it to something else when we go to GitHub :)

content.raw:
looks good to me. I made one minor change to fix to the title [8a240cb](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/8a240cb209c9bf6bd58d48035ffe4807af0a3712) and now the tab title renders properly and the title in tutorial page also shows up fine.

I don’t see the images when generating the doc locally. I’m not sure if that’ll be fixed after uploading to the website. I did notice that in the distributed system tutorialit’s just a link to an image on bytebucket. Maybe @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} knows how to include the images in tutorials.
content.html:
looks good to me. I made one minor change to fix to the title 8a240cb and now the tab title renders properly and the title in tutorial page also shows up fine.

I don’t see the images when generating the doc locally. I’m not sure if that’ll be fixed after uploading to the website. I did notice that in the distributed system tutorialit’s just a link to an image on bytebucket. Maybe @Louise Poubel knows how to include the images in tutorials.

update.title: Point cloud to mesh tutorial

content.raw:
I uploaded the point cloud file to AWS s3 bucket so our tutorial users won’t use up our dropbox daily data limit. Here’s the link: [https://ignition-tutorials.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/ign-gazebo/point\_cloud\_to\_mesh/TutorialExample.zip](https://ignition-tutorials.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/ign-gazebo/point_cloud_to_mesh/TutorialExample.zip)

it’s a direct download link so maybe we should warn the user and let them know it’s a ~100MB file?
content.html:
I uploaded the point cloud file to AWS s3 bucket so our tutorial users won’t use up our dropbox daily data limit. Here’s the link: https://ignition-tutorials.s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/ign-gazebo/point_cloud_to_mesh/TutorialExample.zip

it’s a direct download link so maybe we should warn the user and let them know it’s a ~100MB file?
